# Online resources {-#resources}

## Forest resources management contacts {-#resourcesfrm}

If you have questions about your program, need guidance regarding policy and procedure, or scholarship questions, contact [Gayle Kosh](https://forestry.ubc.ca/students/graduate-student-portal/graduate-student-advising/) at `gayle.kosh@ubc.ca`.

If you have payment or banking questions, message _Joanne Dean_ at `joanne.dean@ubc.ca`. Joanne is the administrative manager for the Department of Forest Resources Management.

## UBC resources - admin {-#resourcesubc}

The [Forestry Graduate Student Portal](https://forestry.ubc.ca/students/graduate-student-portal/) provides links for policies, administrative forms, as well as general links for graduate students. The [GRADBOOK](https://forestry.ubc.ca/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Forestry-Gradbook-2020-21-edition.pdf) will probably answer many of your forestry specific administrative questions.

[Useful information for newly admitted graduate students](https://www.grad.ubc.ca/current-students/newly-admitted) including details about how to apply for your [UBC card](https://ubccard.ubc.ca/), applying for medical insurance, and registering for courses.

## General Vancouver resources {-#resourcesvan}

### Living in Vancouver {-#housing}

If you have not yet looked into accommodation at UBC or in Vancouver check out the [UBC Housing](https://www.grad.ubc.ca/campus-community/life-vancouver/housing?menu=000%2C000%2C000%2C000) portal.  

If you are looking for housing off campus, resources like [Craigslist](https://vancouver.craigslist.org/d/apartments-housing-for-rent/search/apa) and [Kijiji](https://www.kijiji.ca/b-apartments-condos/vancouver/house/c37l1700287a29276001) are good places to start.

```{r, echo=FALSE, out.width="75%",fig.align = 'center',fig.cap="Looking north from Cambie street and 10th Ave."}
knitr::include_graphics("img\\vancouver1.png")
```

### Transit {-#transit}

Vancouver is known for its great public transportation. Once you have your UBC card, you can sign up for a [U-Pass](https://planning.ubc.ca/transportation/transit/u-pass-compass-card) and [compass card to use public transit across the city](https://ubccard.ubc.ca/u-pass-and-compass-card).

Be sure to familiarize yourself with information on [trip planning and how to get where you want to go](https://www.translink.ca/schedules-and-maps/transit-system-maps.aspx).
